cards.name: Ajani Goldmane
cards.text:
+1: You gain 2 life.
−1: Put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control. Those creatures gain vigilance until end of turn.
−6: Create a white Avatar creature token. It has "This creature's power and toughness are each equal to your life total."

rulings.text: The vigilance granted to a creature by the second ability remains until the end of the turn even if the +1/+1 counter is removed.
The power and toughness of the Avatar created by the third ability will change as your life total changes.

foreignNames.name: 黄金のたてがみのアジャニ

cards.originalText:
+1: You gain 2 life.
-1: Put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control. Those creatures gain vigilance until end of turn.
-6: Put a white Avatar creature token into play with "This creature's power and toughness are each equal to your life total."

cards.name: Arbiter of Knollridge
cards.text:
Vigilance
When Arbiter of Knollridge enters the battlefield, each player's life total becomes the highest life total among all players.
cards.flavor: Though giants are mortal, they live so long and on such a grand scale that many small folk don't believe they ever truly die.

rulings.text: Abilities that trigger when a player gains life may trigger as a result of this ability.

In other multiplayer formats, each player's life total is set to the highest life total within their range of influence. These changes happen at the same time. For example, if each player has a range of influence of one, and the players in the game are Alice (4 life), Barry (8 life), Carrie (11 life), and Doug (7 life), in that order, then Alice's life total will become 8 and Barry and Doug's life totals will each become 11.

In a Two-Headed Giant game, each team chooses one person on that team to gain the appropriate amount of life. This basically means that the triggered ability will set the life total of each team to that of the team with the highest life total.

foreignNames.name: ノールリッジの裁き人

cards.originalText:
Vigilance
When Arbiter of Knollridge comes into play, each player's life total becomes the highest life total among all players.

cards.name: Austere Command
cards.text:
Choose two —
• Destroy all artifacts.
• Destroy all enchantments.
• Destroy all creatures with converted mana cost 3 or less.
• Destroy all creatures with converted mana cost 4 or greater.

rulings.text: Each of the chosen modes happens sequentially. If a permanent has an ability that triggers whenever it or another permanent is destroyed, it will see permanents destroyed at the same time as it or before it, but not permanents destroyed by later modes.

If the first and third modes are chosen, an artifact creature with converted mana cost 3 or less will have to be regenerated twice to survive. This is because the modes happen sequentially, and the regeneration "shield" is used up by the first one. (A similar thing happens with most of the other combinations.)

If a card is exiled "until" another permanent leaves the battlefield, the exiled card returns to the battlefield immediately after that permanent leaves the battlefield during Austere Command's resolution, and it may be destroyed by a later mode.

cards.originalText: Choose two Destroy all artifacts; or destroy all enchantments; or destroy all creatures with converted mana cost 3 or less; or destroy all creatures with converted mana cost 4 or greater.

cards.name: Avian Changeling
cards.text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
Flying
cards.flavor: Today it flies with the flock. Tomorrow it may wake to find them gone, its body in an unfamiliar form.
cards.originalText:
Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.)
Flying

cards.name: Battle Mastery
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has double strike. (It deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)
cards.flavor:
"Boom Boom Boots the size of oxcarts, then an axe like a falling sun. Elves scattered. Trees scattered. Even the hills ran for the hills"
—Clachan Tales

rulings.text: If a creature loses double strike after dealing combat damage in the first combat damage step, it won't assign combat damage in the second one.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has double strike.

cards.name: Brigid, Hero of Kinsbaile
cards.text:
First strike
{T}: Brigid, Hero of Kinsbaile deals 2 damage to each attacking or blocking creature target player controls.
cards.flavor: Thanks to one champion archer, the true borders of Kinsbaile extend an arrow's flight beyond the buildings.

foreignNames.name: キンズベイルの勇士、ブリジッド

cards.originalText:
First strike
{T}: Brigid, Hero of Kinsbaile deals 2 damage to each attacking or blocking creature target player controls.

cards.name: Burrenton Forge-Tender
cards.text:
Protection from red
Sacrifice Burrenton Forge-Tender: Prevent all damage a red source of your choice would deal this turn.
cards.flavor: "We are a clachan of smiths. The forge is as comfortable to us as a small fire during a cool winter's evening."

rulings.text: If the red source you chose changes colors before it deals damage, the damage-prevention effect doesn't apply.
The last ability of Burrenton Forge-Tender doesn't target anything. You choose a source of damage as the ability resolves, if able. You can activate it even if there is no source to choose.

If a permanent spell is chosen as the source of damage, Burrenton Forge-Tender's prevention effect continues to apply for the rest of the turn to the permanent that spell becomes once it has entered the battlefield.

foreignNames.name: Veilleuse de la forge de Burrenton
ブレンタンの炉の世話人

cards.originalText:
Protection from red
Sacrifice Burrenton Forge-Tender: Prevent all damage a red source of your choice would deal this turn.

cards.name: Cenn's Heir
cards.text: Whenever Cenn's Heir attacks, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each other attacking Kithkin.
cards.flavor: His home clachan's familial spirit bolsters his own, but he will be ready to preside over the town as cenn only after he learns to project that strength to others.
cards.originalText: Whenever Cenn's Heir attacks, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each other attacking Kithkin.

cards.name: Changeling Hero
cards.text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
Champion a creature (When this enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you exile another creature you control. When this leaves the battlefield, that card returns to the battlefield.)
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
cards.originalText:
Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.)
Champion a creature (When this comes into play, sacrifice it unless you remove another creature you control from the game. When this leaves play, that card returns to play.)
Lifelink (Whenever this creature deals damage, you gain that much life.)

When Cloudgoat Ranger comes into play, put three 1/1 white Kithkin Soldier creature tokens into play.
Tap three untapped Kithkin you control: Cloudgoat Ranger gets +2/+0 and gains flying until end of turn.

Changeling (This card is every creature type.)

cards.name: Dawnfluke
cards.text:
Flash
When Dawnfluke enters the battlefield, prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
Evoke {W} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)

rulings.text: If you cast this card for its evoke cost, you may put the sacrifice trigger and the regular enters-the-battlefield trigger on the stack in either order. The one put on the stack last will resolve first.

cards.originalText:
Flash
When Dawnfluke comes into play, prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
Evoke {W} (You may play this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it comes into play.)

cards.name: Entangling Trap
cards.text: Whenever you clash, tap target creature an opponent controls. If you won, that creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step. (This ability triggers after the clash ends.)

rulings.text: If you clash because of a spell or ability an opponent controls, the ability will still trigger. Likewise, you can still win the clash even if you weren't the player to initiate it.

cards.originalText: Whenever you clash, tap target creature an opponent controls. If you won, that creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step. (This ability triggers after the clash ends.)

cards.name: Favor of the Mighty
cards.text: Each creature with the highest converted mana cost has protection from all colors.
cards.flavor:
"What does a mountain fear of a fly? Giants are barely aware of us, let alone afraid."
—Gaddock Teeg

rulings.text: If there's a tie for highest converted mana cost, all of those creatures have protection from all colors.
This effect is checked continuously. If a new creature enters the battlefield with the highest converted mana cost, it gains protection from all colors and the previous highest loses it.
If a creature has X in its mana cost, that X is treated as 0 for the purposes of this effect. It doesn't matter what the value of X was while the creature was on the stack.

cards.originalText: Each creature with the highest converted mana cost has protection from all colors.

cards.name: Galepowder Mage
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Galepowder Mage attacks, exile another target creature. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.

rulings.text: Galepowder Mage's ability can target a creature controlled by any player. It's not optional.
The exiled card will be returned to the battlefield at the beginning of the end step even if Galepowder Mage is no longer on the battlefield at that time.
If Galepowder Mage is the only creature on the battlefield when it attacks, its ability has no effect.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Galepowder Mage attacks, remove another target creature from the game. Return that card to play under its owner's control at end of turn.

cards.name: Goldmeadow Dodger
cards.text: Goldmeadow Dodger can't be blocked by creatures with power 4 or greater.
cards.flavor: "I've gotten close enough to a giant to smell his breath, but none has ever so much as spotted me. I wonder how long my record can extend?"

rulings.text: After Goldmeadow Dodger becomes blocked, increasing the blocking creature's power to 4 or greater has no effect on the block.

foreignNames.name: ゴールドメドウの身かわし

cards.originalText: Goldmeadow Dodger can't be blocked by creatures with power 4 or greater.

cards.name: Goldmeadow Harrier
cards.text: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.
cards.flavor:

—Deagan, cenn of Burrenton

cards.text: As an additional cost to cast this spell, reveal a Kithkin card from your hand or pay {3}.
cards.flavor: The thoughtweft ties a clachan together. Sharing each other's hopes and fears, all the village's citizens spring into action upon the first threat to any one of them.

cards.originalText: As an additional cost to play Goldmeadow Stalwart, reveal a Kithkin card from your hand or pay {3}.

cards.originalText: {W}, {T}: Harpoon Sniper deals X damage to target attacking or blocking creature, where X is the number of Merfolk you control.

cards.name: Hillcomber Giant
cards.text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
cards.flavor: The giants believe the fossils they find in Lorwyn's rocky heights are dreams frozen in time, and they treasure them.

cards.name: Hoofprints of the Stag
cards.text:
Whenever you draw a card, you may put a hoofprint counter on Hoofprints of the Stag.
{2}{W}, Remove four hoofprint counters from Hoofprints of the Stag: Create a 4/4 white Elemental creature token with flying. Activate this ability only during your turn.

rulings.text: If a spell or ability has you draw multiple cards, Hoofprints of the Stag's ability triggers that many times.

cards.originalText:
Whenever you draw a card, you may put a hoofprint counter on Hoofprints of the Stag.
{2}{W}, Remove four hoofprint counters from Hoofprints of the Stag: Put a 4/4 white Elemental creature token with flying into play. Play this ability only during your turn.

cards.name: Judge of Currents
cards.text: Whenever a Merfolk you control becomes tapped, you may gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: Though the currents of the Lanes shift every year, the merrow never lose track of where they are or where they are going.

rulings.text: This is a triggered ability, not an activated ability. It doesn't allow you to tap the creature whenever you want; rather, you need some other way of tapping it, such as by attacking with the creature.
For the ability to trigger, the creature has to actually change from untapped to tapped. If an effect attempts to tap the creature, but it was already tapped at the time, this ability won't trigger.

cards.originalText: Whenever a Merfolk you control becomes tapped, you may gain 1 life.

cards.name: Kinsbaile Balloonist
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Kinsbaile Balloonist attacks, you may have target creature gain flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Even when a giant's tantrum turns the sky into a chaotic gale, the path of the balloonist never falters.

foreignNames.name: キンズベイルの風船使い

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Kinsbaile Balloonist attacks, you may have target creature gain flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Kinsbaile Skirmisher
cards.text: When Kinsbaile Skirmisher enters the battlefield, target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "If a boggart even dares breathe near one of my kin, I'll know. And I'll not be happy."
cards.originalText: When Kinsbaile Skirmisher comes into play, target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Kithkin Greatheart
cards.text: As long as you control a Giant, Kithkin Greatheart gets +1/+1 and has first strike.
cards.flavor: Sometimes a curious giant singles out a "little one" to follow for a few days, never realizing the effect it will have on the little one's life.

rulings.text: If, after dealing first-strike combat damage, Kithkin Greatheart loses first strike (perhaps because the Giant you controlled was destroyed by first-strike combat damage), it won't deal regular combat damage.

cards.originalText: As long as you control a Giant, Kithkin Greatheart gets +1/+1 and has first strike.

cards.name: Kithkin Harbinger
cards.text: When Kithkin Harbinger enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Kithkin card, reveal it, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.
cards.flavor: Her ears are open to even the softest voice.
cards.originalText: When Kithkin Harbinger comes into play, you may search your library for a Kithkin card, reveal it, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.

cards.name: Kithkin Healer
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
cards.flavor: The empathetic nature of the thoughtweft allows kithkin healers to treat the cause of an illness rather than fight its symptoms.
cards.originalText: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.text:
First strike
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
cards.flavor: "By tradition, we don't speak for two days after battle. If our deeds won't speak for themselves, what else could be said?"

foreignNames.name: メドウグレインの騎士

cards.originalText:
First strike
Lifelink (Whenever this creature deals damage, you gain that much life.)

cards.name: Lairwatch Giant
cards.text:
Lairwatch Giant can block an additional creature each combat.
Whenever Lairwatch Giant blocks two or more creatures, it gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor: A giant can brood over a grudge for decades, and woe to those who interrupt him.

rulings.text: Lairwatch Giant's second ability triggers if it blocks at least two creatures when blockers are declared. It will also trigger if it blocks fewer than two creatures when blockers are declared and effects then cause it to block more creatures. However, if Lairwatch Giant is already blocking two or more creatures, and effects then cause it to block more creatures, the ability won't trigger again.

cards.originalText:
Lairwatch Giant can block an additional creature.
Whenever Lairwatch Giant blocks two or more creatures, it gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Militia's Pride
cards.text: Whenever a nontoken creature you control attacks, you may pay {W}. If you do, create a 1/1 white Kithkin Soldier creature token that's tapped and attacking.
cards.flavor: If you pick a fight with one kithkin, be ready to fight them all.

rulings.text: The token enters the battlefield attacking. It doesn't trigger "when a creature attacks" triggers and is not subject to restrictions on declaring attackers.
You choose which player or planeswalker the token is attacking. It doesn't have to attack the same player or planeswalker as the creature that caused the ability to trigger.

cards.originalText: Whenever a nontoken creature you control attacks, you may pay {W}. If you do, put a 1/1 white Kithkin Soldier creature token into play tapped and attacking.

cards.name: Mirror Entity
cards.text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
{X}: Until end of turn, creatures you control have base power and toughness X/X and gain all creature types.
cards.flavor: Unaware of Lorwyn's diversity, it sees only itself, reflected a thousand times over.

rulings.text: Activating the ability with X = 0 will cause all creatures you control to become 0/0 and be put into the graveyard.

Activating the ability for a second time in the same turn will overwrite the first activation. For example, if you activate the ability with X = 4, then activate it with X = 1, each of your creatures will be 1/1.

You apply power/toughness changing effects in a series of sublayers in the following order: (a) effects from characteristic-defining abilities; (b) effects that set power and/or toughness to a specific number or value; (c) effects that modify power and/or toughness but don't set power and/or toughness to a specific number or value; (d) changes from counters; (e) effects that switch a creature's power and toughness. This card's effect is always applied in (b), which means that effects applied in sublayer (c), (d), or (e) will not be overwritten; they will be applied to the new value.
Examples of creature types include Sliver, Goblin, and Soldier. Creature types appear after the dash on the type line of creatures.

cards.originalText:
Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.)
{X}: Creatures you control become X/X and gain all creature types until end of turn.

cards.name: Neck Snap
cards.text: Destroy target attacking or blocking creature.
cards.flavor:
"We merrows need not be disadvantaged when fighting on land. We lack the vulnerability of those who breathe only through their throats."
—Minnarin, merrow reejerey
cards.originalText: Destroy target attacking or blocking creature.

cards.name: Oaken Brawler
cards.text: When Oaken Brawler enters the battlefield, clash with an opponent. If you win, put a +1/+1 counter on Oaken Brawler. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of their library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if their card had a higher converted mana cost.)
cards.originalText: When Oaken Brawler comes into play, clash with an opponent. If you win, put a +1/+1 counter on Oaken Brawler. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)

cards.name: Oblivion Ring
cards.text:
When Oblivion Ring enters the battlefield, exile another target nonland permanent.
When Oblivion Ring leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.
cards.flavor: A circle of sugar and a word of forbiddance.

rulings.text: If Oblivion Ring leaves the battlefield before its first ability has resolved, its second ability will trigger and do nothing. Then its first ability will resolve and exile the targeted nonland permanent forever.

If there are no nonland permanents on the battlefield other than an Oblivion Ring, and the card it exiled was another Oblivion Ring, casting a third Oblivion Ring will result in an involuntary infinite loop that will end the game in a draw (unless someone chooses to break it by putting another nonland permanent onto the battlefield or destroying one of the Oblivion Rings, for example).

If the exiled card is an Aura, that card's owner chooses what it will enchant as it comes back onto the battlefield. An Aura put onto the battlefield this way doesn't target anything, but the Aura's enchant ability restricts what it can be attached to. If the Aura can't legally be attached to anything, it remains exiled forever.

Auras attached to the exiled permanent will be put into their owners' graveyards. Equipment attached to the exiled permanent will become unattached and remain on the battlefield. Any counters on the exiled permanent will cease to exist.

cards.originalText:
When Oblivion Ring comes into play, remove another target nonland permanent from the game.
When Oblivion Ring leaves play, return the removed card to play under its owner's control.

cards.name: Plover Knights
cards.text: Flying, first strike
cards.flavor: The knights are a major attraction at every Lammastide festival. Teams of riders perform daring feats of flight to the delight of all below.
cards.originalText: Flying, first strike

cards.name: Pollen Lullaby
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn. Clash with an opponent. If you win, creatures that player controls don't untap during the player's next untap step. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of their library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if their card had a higher converted mana cost.)
cards.originalText: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn. Clash with an opponent. If you win, creatures that player controls don't untap during the player's next untap step. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)

cards.name: Purity
cards.text:
Flying
If noncombat damage would be dealt to you, prevent that damage. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.
When Purity is put into a graveyard from anywhere, shuffle it into its owner's library.

rulings.text: The last ability triggers when the Incarnation is put into its owner's graveyard from any zone, not just from on the battlefield.

Although this ability triggers when the Incarnation is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, it doesn't *specifically* trigger on leaving the battlefield, so it doesn't behave like other leaves-the-battlefield abilities. The ability will trigger from the graveyard.

If the Incarnation had lost this ability while on the battlefield (due to Lignify, for example) and then was destroyed, the ability would still trigger and it would get shuffled into its owner's library. However, if the Incarnation lost this ability when it was put into the graveyard (due to Yixlid Jailer, for example), the ability wouldn't trigger and the Incarnation would remain in the graveyard.

If the Incarnation is removed from the graveyard after the ability triggers but before it resolves, it will remain in its new zone when its owner shuffles their library. Similarly, if a replacement effect has the Incarnation move to a different zone instead of being put into the graveyard, the ability won't trigger at all.

cards.originalText:
Flying
If a spell or ability would deal damage to you, prevent that damage. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.
When Purity is put into a graveyard from anywhere, shuffle it into its owner's library.

cards.name: Sentry Oak
cards.text:
Defender
At the beginning of combat on your turn, you may clash with an opponent. If you win, Sentry Oak gets +2/+0 and loses defender until end of turn. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of their library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if their card had a higher converted mana cost.)

rulings.text: Specifically, this ability triggers when the beginning of combat step starts during your turn.

cards.originalText:

At the beginning of combat on your turn, you may clash with an opponent. If you win, Sentry Oak gets +2/+0 and loses defender until end of turn. cards.name: Veteran of the Depths
cards.text: Whenever Veteran of the Depths becomes tapped, you may put a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor: In the backwaters of the Merrow Lanes lie stones scarred with tallies of countless generations, each representing a victory of merrow soldiers.

rulings.text: This is a triggered ability, not an activated ability. It doesn't allow you to tap the creature whenever you want; rather, you need some other way of tapping it, such as by attacking with the creature.
For the ability to trigger, the creature has to actually change from untapped to tapped. If an effect attempts to tap the creature, but it was already tapped at the time, this ability won't trigger.

cards.originalText: Whenever Veteran of the Depths becomes tapped, you may put a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Wellgabber Apothecary
cards.text: {1}{W}: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to target tapped Merfolk or Kithkin creature this turn.
cards.flavor: "You've discovered that boggarts bite, I see. And will the militia be chasing this lot? . . . Ah, you're staying in town to avoid Nath's hunt. Wise. Now this poultice . . ."

rulings.text: The targeted creature must be tapped when the ability is activated and when it resolves. It doesn't need to remain tapped in between.

Once the ability has resolved, all damage that would be dealt to that creature for the rest of the turn will be prevented, regardless of whether it's tapped or untapped at the time that damage would be dealt.

cards.originalText: {1}{W}: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to target tapped Merfolk or Kithkin creature this turn.

cards.name: Wispmare
cards.text:
Flying
When Wispmare enters the battlefield, destroy target enchantment.
Evoke {W} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)

rulings.text: If you cast this card for its evoke cost, you may put the sacrifice trigger and the regular enters-the-battlefield trigger on the stack in either order. The one put on the stack last will resolve first.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Wispmare comes into play, destroy target enchantment.
Evoke {W} (You may play this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it comes into play.)

cards.name: Wizened Cenn
cards.text: Other Kithkin creatures you control get +1/+1.
cards.flavor: "Thoughtweft binds us together as one, part of an intricate pattern that would unravel if even one thread came loose."
cards.originalText: Other Kithkin creatures you control get +1/+1.

cards.name: Aethersnipe
cards.text:
When Aethersnipe enters the battlefield, return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand.
Evoke {1}{U}{U} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)

rulings.text: If you cast this card for its evoke cost, you may put the sacrifice trigger and the regular enters-the-battlefield trigger on the stack in either order. The one put on the stack last will resolve first.

cards.originalText:
When Æthersnipe comes into play, return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand.
Evoke {1}{U}{U} (You may play this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it comes into play.)

cards.name: Amoeboid Changeling
cards.text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
{T}: Target creature gains all creature types until end of turn.
{T}: Target creature loses all creature types until end of turn.

rulings.text: If a creature loses all creature types but then gains a new creature type later in the turn, it will be that new creature type.
Examples of creature types include Sliver, Goblin, and Soldier. Creature types appear after the dash on the type line of creatures.

cards.originalText:
Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.)
{T}: Target creature gains all creature types until end of turn.
{T}: Target creature loses all creature types until end of turn.

cards.name: Aquitect's Will
cards.text: Put a flood counter on target land. That land is an Island in addition to its other types for as long as it has a flood counter on it. If you control a Merfolk, draw a card.
cards.flavor: There is nowhere on Lorwyn that the Merrow Lanes cannot go.
cards.originalText: Put a flood counter on target land. That land is an Island in addition to its other types as long as it has a flood counter on it. If you control a Merfolk, draw a card.

cards.name: Benthicore
cards.text:
When Benthicore enters the battlefield, create two 1/1 blue Merfolk Wizard creature tokens.
Tap two untapped Merfolk you control: Untap Benthicore. It gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.originalText:
When Benthicore comes into play, put two 1/1 blue Merfolk Wizard creature tokens into play.
Tap two untapped Merfolk you control: Untap Benthicore. It gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

cards.name: Broken Ambitions
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. Clash with an opponent. If you win, that spell's controller puts the top four cards of their library into their graveyard. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of their library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if their card had a higher converted mana cost.)

rulings.text: The opponent you clash with doesn't have to be the controller of the targeted spell.
The clash (and the result of the clash if you win) happens regardless of whether the targeted spell was countered or {X} was paid.

cards.originalText: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. Clash with an opponent. If you win, that spell's controller puts the top four cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)

cards.name: Captivating Glance
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your end step, clash with an opponent. If you win, gain control of enchanted creature. Otherwise, that player gains control of enchanted creature. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of their library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if their card had a higher converted mana cost.)

rulings.text: The ability triggers at the end of Captivating Glance's controller's turn. "You" refers to the controller of Captivating Glance, not the controller of the enchanted creature.
The opponent you clash with doesn't have to be the controller of the enchanted creature.

If you win the clash, you gain control of the enchanted creature. If you don't win the clash, the other player gains control of the enchanted creature (even if that player didn't win the clash either).
Captivating Glance's controller never changes as a result of this card.
Captivating Glance may cause a player to gain control of a creature they already control. This layers a new control effect on that creature, but doing so rarely has any visible effect.
Captivating Glance's control-change effect continues to apply even if Captivating Glance leaves the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
At the end of your turn, clash with an opponent. If you win, gain control of enchanted creature. Otherwise, that player gains control of enchanted creature. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)

cards.name: Cryptic Command
cards.text:
Choose two —
• Counter target spell.
• Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
• Tap all creatures your opponents control.
• Draw a card.

rulings.text: You choose both modes as you cast Cryptic Command. You must choose two different modes.

Look at both chosen modes to determine how many targets Cryptic Command has, if any. If it has at least one target, and all its targets are illegal when it tries to resolve, then it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. For example, if you choose the second and fourth modes, and the permanent is an illegal target when Cryptic Command tries to resolve, you won't draw a card.

cards.originalText: Choose two Counter target spell; or return target permanent to its owner's hand; or tap all creatures your opponents control; or draw a card.

cards.name: Deeptread Merrow
cards.text: {U}: Deeptread Merrow gains islandwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
cards.flavor: "My success at navigating the Dark Meanders irritates the Inkfathom school. They consider themselves peerless divers, but I try to remind them that they cannot own commodities like bravery and cunning."
cards.originalText: {U}: Deeptread Merrow gains islandwalk until end of turn.

cards.name: Drowner of Secrets
cards.text: Tap an untapped Merfolk you control: Target player puts the top card of their library into their graveyard.
cards.flavor: Merrows consider themselves the keepers of Lorwyn's past—and consider it their duty to edit when necessary.

rulings.text: You can tap any permanent with the Merfolk creature type to pay for the ability, including noncreature tribal permanents such as Merrow Commerce.

cards.originalText: Tap an untapped Merfolk you control: Target player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Ego Erasure
cards.text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
Creatures target player controls get -2/-0 and lose all creature types until end of turn.
cards.flavor: When all is taken away, all are equal.

rulings.text: If a creature loses all creature types but then gains a new creature type later in the turn, it will be that new creature type.
Examples of creature types include Sliver, Goblin, and Soldier. Creature types appear after the dash on the type line of creatures.

cards.originalText:
Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.)
Creatures target player controls get -2/-0 and lose all creature types until end of turn.

cards.text:
Flying
Ethereal Whiskergill can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
cards.flavor: Fallowsages debate whether the whiskergill is native to the Dark Meanders or merely dreamstuff made real.

Flying
Ethereal Whiskergill can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.

cards.name: Faerie Trickery
cards.text: Counter target non-Faerie spell. If that spell is countered this way, exile it instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard.
cards.flavor: The fae are so quick and their life spans so short that it's difficult to get retribution for their pranks.
cards.originalText: Counter target non-Faerie spell. If that spell is countered this way, remove it from the game instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard.

cards.name: Fallowsage
cards.text: Whenever Fallowsage becomes tapped, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor: Memories of ages past are said to swim the minds of lounging fallowsages.

rulings.text: This is a triggered ability, not an activated ability. It doesn't allow you to tap the creature whenever you want; rather, you need some other way of tapping it, such as by attacking with the creature.
For the ability to trigger, the creature has to actually change from untapped to tapped. If an effect attempts to tap the creature, but it was already tapped at the time, this ability won't trigger.

cards.originalText: Whenever Fallowsage becomes tapped, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Familiar's Ruse
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, return a creature you control to its owner's hand.
Counter target spell.
cards.flavor: Because of their capricious nature, faeries can serve as living lenses for disruptive magic.

rulings.text: Familiar's Ruse can't be cast without a target spell. It can't target itself.

cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to play Familiar's Ruse, return a creature you control to its owner's hand.
Counter target spell.

cards.name: Fathom Trawl
cards.text: Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal three nonland cards. Put the nonland cards revealed this way into your hand, then put the rest of the revealed cards on the bottom of your library in any order.

rulings.text: If there are fewer than three nonland cards in your library, you will reveal your entire library, put all nonland cards into your hand, and put the rest back in any order.

cards.originalText: Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal three nonland cards. Put the nonland cards revealed this way into your hand, then put the rest of the revealed cards on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.name: Forced Fruition
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, that player draws seven cards.
cards.flavor:
"Petals within petals within petals, tadpole. The truth lurks below an opulence of illusion."
—Neerdiv, fallowsage

rulings.text: Yes, the opponent draws seven cards. It's not optional.

cards.originalText: Whenever an opponent plays a spell, that player draws seven cards.

cards.name: Glen Elendra Pranksters
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a spell during an opponent's turn, you may return target creature you control to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Victims spirited through a faerie ring find themselves stranded miles away.

foreignNames.name: エレンドラ谷のいたずら者

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever you play a spell during an opponent's turn, you may return target creature you control to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Glimmerdust Nap
cards.text:
Enchant tapped creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
cards.flavor: The dreams of giants are as long as time and as deep as the earth. Thus they are prized by the dream-harvesting fae.

rulings.text: Glimmerdust Nap can target only a tapped creature.
If the targeted creature has become untapped by the time Glimmerdust Nap would resolve, Glimmerdust Nap doesn't resolve for having an illegal target.
If the enchanted creature becomes untapped, Glimmerdust Nap is put into its owner's graveyard as a state-based action.

foreignNames.name: ちらつき粉のうたた寝

cards.originalText:
Enchant tapped creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

cards.name: Guile
cards.text:
Guile can't be blocked except by three or more creatures.
If a spell or ability you control would counter a spell, instead exile that spell and you may play that card without paying its mana cost.
When Guile is put into a graveyard from anywhere, shuffle it into its owner's library.

rulings.text: Guile's second ability replaces "counter [a certain spell]" with "exile [a certain spell] and you may cast it without paying its mana cost." You have the option to cast it immediately upon its exile. If you choose not to, it remains exiled and you don't get another chance to cast it. If the spell or ability that tried to counter the spell has additional effects, it then continues to resolve.
Exiling the spell is mandatory. Casting it is not.
A spell exiled this way was never actually countered.

If a spell or ability you control attempts to counter a spell that can't be countered, it doesn't. Since the spell wouldn't be countered, Guile's ability has no effect on it. The spell will continue to resolve normally.
The last ability triggers when the Incarnation is put into its owner's graveyard from any zone, not just from on the battlefield.

Although this ability triggers when the Incarnation is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, it doesn't *specifically* trigger on leaving the battlefield, so it doesn't behave like other leaves-the-battlefield abilities. The ability will trigger from the graveyard.

If the Incarnation had lost this ability while on the battlefield (due to Lignify, for example) and then was destroyed, the ability would still trigger and it would get shuffled into its owner's library. However, if the Incarnation lost this ability when it was put into the graveyard (due to Yixlid Jailer, for example), the ability wouldn't trigger and the Incarnation would remain in the graveyard.

If the Incarnation is removed from the graveyard after the ability triggers but before it resolves, it will remain in its new zone when its owner shuffles their library. Similarly, if a replacement effect has the Incarnation move to a different zone instead of being put into the graveyard, the ability won't trigger at all.

cards.originalText:
Guile can't be blocked except by three or more creatures.
If a spell or ability you control would counter a spell, instead remove that spell from the game and you may play that card without paying its mana cost.
When Guile is put into a graveyard from anywhere, shuffle it into its owner's library.

cards.name: Inkfathom Divers
cards.text:
Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
When Inkfathom Divers enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
cards.flavor:
"None appreciate sun and shallows like those who have seen the depths."
—Lianda of the Stonybrook school
cards.originalText:
Islandwalk
When Inkfathom Divers comes into play, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

cards.name: Jace Beleren
cards.text:
+2: Each player draws a card.
−1: Target player draws a card.
−10: Target player puts the top twenty cards of their library into their graveyard.

rulings.text: If there are fewer than twenty cards in the targeted player's library, that player puts all the cards from their library into their graveyard.

cards.originalText:
+2: Each player draws a card.
-1: Target player draws a card.
-10: Target player puts the top twenty cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Merrow Commerce
cards.text: At the beginning of your end step, untap all Merfolk you control.
cards.flavor: Schools meet and mingle on Lorwyn's riverways. In the bustling interplay, the merrow renew their sense of community as they sharpen their wits and hone their trading skills.
cards.originalText: At the end of your turn, untap all Merfolk you control.

cards.text:
Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)

Islandwalk

cards.name: Merrow Reejerey
cards.text:
Other Merfolk creatures you control get +1/+1.
Whenever you cast a Merfolk spell, you may tap or untap target permanent.
cards.flavor: Steady and silent as the deep current, the reejerey guides the course of the school.
cards.originalText:
Other Merfolk creatures you control get +1/+1.

cards.name: Mistbind Clique
cards.text:
Flash
Flying
Champion a Faerie (When this enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you exile another Faerie you control. When this leaves the battlefield, that card returns to the battlefield.)
When a Faerie is championed with Mistbind Clique, tap all lands target player controls.
cards.originalText:
Flash
Flying
Champion a Faerie (When this comes into play, sacrifice it unless you remove another Faerie you control from the game. When this leaves play, that card returns to play.)
When a Faerie is championed with Mistbind Clique, tap all lands target player controls.

cards.name: Mulldrifter
cards.text:
Flying
When Mulldrifter enters the battlefield, draw two cards.
Evoke {2}{U} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)

rulings.text: Evoke is an alternative cost to cast the spell with evoke. It can't be combined with other alternative costs, such as casting a spell "without paying its mana cost."

To determine the total cost of a spell, start with the mana cost or alternative cost (such as an evoke cost) you're paying, add any cost increases, then apply any cost reductions. The converted mana cost of the spell remains unchanged, no matter what the total cost to cast it was.
If a creature with evoke enters the battlefield without being cast, you won't have to sacrifice it.
The ability that causes you to sacrifice an evoked creature is a triggered ability. Players may respond to this triggered ability while the creature is still on the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Mulldrifter comes into play, draw two cards.
Evoke {2}{U} (You may play this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it comes into play.)

cards.name: Paperfin Rascal
cards.text: When Paperfin Rascal enters the battlefield, clash with an opponent. If you win, put a +1/+1 counter on Paperfin Rascal. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of their library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if their card had a higher converted mana cost.)
cards.originalText: When Paperfin Rascal comes into play, clash with an opponent. If you win, put a +1/+1 counter on Paperfin Rascal. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)

cards.originalText:
Flash
Flying
When Pestermite comes into play, you may tap or untap target permanent.

cards.name: Ponder
cards.text:
Look at the top three cards of your library, then put them back in any order. You may shuffle your library.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: "We see the same sky as you, just through a different lens."

rulings.text: If you choose to shuffle your library, that includes the three cards you just looked at and put back on top of it.

cards.originalText:
Look at the top three cards of your library, then put them back in any order. You may shuffle your library.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Protective Bubble
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't be blocked and has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.flavor: Skilled merrow rudders ensure their charges arrive on time and without incident.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature is unblockable and has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

cards.name: Ringskipper
cards.text:
Flying
When Ringskipper dies, clash with an opponent. If you win, return Ringskipper to its owner's hand. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of their library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if their card had a higher converted mana cost.)

rulings.text: If Ringskipper is removed from the graveyard before the ability resolves, you still clash, but nothing will happen if you win.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Ringskipper is put into a graveyard from play, clash with an opponent. If you win, return Ringskipper to its owner's hand. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)

cards.name: Scattering Stroke
cards.text: Counter target spell. Clash with an opponent. If you win, at the beginning of your next main phase, you may add an amount of {C} equal to that spell's converted mana cost. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of their library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if their card had a higher converted mana cost.)

rulings.text: You decide whether or not to add that much {C} to your mana pool as the delayed triggered ability resolves at the beginning of your next main phase. You don't decide before then.
You can't add just some of the mana to your mana pool. You either add all the mana to your mana pool or none of it.

cards.originalText: Counter target spell. Clash with an opponent. If you win, at the beginning of your next main phase, you may add {X} to your mana pool, where X is that spell's converted mana cost. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)

Flash
Flying
Other Faerie creatures you control get +1/+1.
Other Faeries you control have shroud. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)
cards.originalText:
